oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Do organic farmers feel happier than conventional ones? An exploratory analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mzoughi , Naoufel
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Health and welfare
Regulation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We examine the relationship between organic farming and subjective well-being or life satisfaction. Applying an ordered probit model to a sample of French farmers located in the Provence-Alpes-CÃ´te d'Azur (PACA) area (Southeast), we find that organic farmers report higher levels of life satisfaction, compared to the conventional ones. Moreover, this positive relationship holds for both recently-converted and earlier-converted farmers. Our findings also show that subjective well-being is positively associated with income, profitability, satisfaction at work, social recognition, and good health.
